title: Introduction to `fa` and `fe`
goal: Learn place tags as an alternative to conversions for flexible word order.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Conversion review — which conversion focuses on each place?

x2 → ?
x3 → ?
x4 → ?
x5 → ?

(Answers: se, te, ve, xe)

New Material (5-7 min)

Place Tags: Another Way to Reorder

fe la cukta fa mi cu dunda fi la .bob. — I give a book to Bob.

Conversions (se/te/ve/xe) are one way to put different arguments first. Place tags are another — they explicitly mark which place each sumti fills.

The Five Place Tags

Tag Marks
fa x1 (first place)
fe x2 (second place)
fi x3 (third place)
fo x4 (fourth place)
fu x5 (fifth place)

How Tags Work

Instead of relying on position, you label each sumti:

Normal With Tags
mi dunda la cukta la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta fi la .bob.

Both mean: I give a book to Bob.

Reordering with Tags

Tags let you put sumti in any order:

Order Sentence
Normal mi dunda la cukta la .bob.
Gift first fe la cukta fa mi cu dunda fi la .bob.
Recipient first fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta

All three mean the same thing — the tags tell you which place each sumti fills.

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
spuda x1 replies to x2 with response x3 reply
retsku x1 asks x2 from source x3 about x4 ask

Examples with fa and fe

Sentence Meaning
fa mi cu viska fe la cukta I see a book.
fe la cukta fa mi cu viska I see a book. (book mentioned first)
fa la .bob. cu spuda fe la .alis. Bob replies to Alice.

Key Point

Place tags (fa/fe/fi/fo/fu) explicitly mark which place each sumti fills, allowing any word order.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Add Tags

Rewrite with explicit fa and fe tags:

  1. mi viska la gerku → ?
  2. la .bob. cu prami la .alis. → ?
  3. do nelci la plise → ?
Answers
  1. fa mi cu viska fe la gerku
  2. fa la .bob. cu prami fe la .alis.
  3. fa do cu nelci fe la plise

Exercise 2: Reorder with Tags

Rewrite with the underlined element first, using tags:

  1. mi viska __la cukta__ → ? (book first)
  2. la .bob. cu prami __la .alis.__ → ? (Alice first)
  3. mi dunda la skami __la .tam.__ → ? (Tom first)
Answers
  1. fe la cukta fa mi cu viska
  2. fe la .alis. fa la .bob. cu prami
  3. fi la .tam. fa mi cu dunda fe la skami

Exercise 3: Interpret Tagged Sentences

Translate to English:

  1. fe la karce fa la .alis. cu ponse
  2. fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta
  3. fa do cu spuda fe mi
Answers
  1. Alice owns a car.
  2. I give a book to Bob.
  3. You reply to me.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I see a book." (normal) → mi viska la cukta
  2. "I see a book." (with tags) → fa mi cu viska fe la cukta
  3. "A book, I see." (book first) → fe la cukta fa mi cu viska

Today's Vocab

Lojban Place Structure English
spuda x1 replies to x2 with response x3 reply
retsku x1 asks x2 from x3 about x4 ask

Place tags:

Tag Marks
fa x1
fe x2

x1 asks x2 from x3 about x4

sections.content:
Summary

You learned fa (marks x1) and fe (marks x2) as place tags. Tags let you put sumti in any order while explicitly marking their roles. This is an alternative to conversions.

Tomorrow preview: You'll add fi for the third place, enabling full three-place flexibility.
